ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed my abilities in the Spanish language including speaking, writing, and reading
I gained a much better understanding of the spanish language
I improved my Spanish, I feel as though I exercise Spanish in a more thoughtful way
Not much this class was a lot of busy work but I did learn some good grammar insights. Not complaints about the professor she was amazing and very catering to her students.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength of the course is the small seminar style format of the class that allows for conversation. The weakness of the course is the constant tedious work.
No weaknesses. The class was taught well, the exercises and in class essays served a purpose, and a variety of assignments kept the class from being uninteresting.
This class could be improved by not doing sooo much it was a lot of busy work I would have preferred more detailed assignments but with less it was very overwhelming

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you want to improve your Spanish, take this course.
Yes, definitely. It a great space to connect with the language and culture of your heritage country with classmates who are open and willing to learn with one another.
Yes, I would recommend this course to all heritage Spanish speakers that want to improve their abilities in the language

I would recommend it 100%. The class is definitely challenging in terms of learning and having new material become second nature without thought, but it does well to not only help your Spanish, but to explore more of the Spanish world.
I would for the community and professor not so much for the work
